content.body: Is there any effort presently to standardize <video> performance information?
mkanat: yeah, there's a wiki page on it and discussion on the whatwg list
mkanat: it's on my list of things to get to eventually
Hixie: Cool. It's probably something I will take an interest in as a user.
(In my YouTube capacity, not my Bugzilla capacity. :-) )
man, w3.org is down as often as whatwg.org
and i'm paying for whatwg.org with loose change
Ha.
Dude, you're paying for whatwg.org yourself?
TabAtkins: it's the same box as hixie.ch (and about 60 other domains)
Hixie: You haven't spent decades telling the world's software to DDOS your server
k well i guess i can't get any work done if i can't get to w3.org
did they get hit by the storm maybe?
MikeSmith: yt?
shepazu: yt?
Hixie: here now
was out for an evening constitutional
hmmm… you're right, looks like w3.org is down… (at least some servers)
weird!
vincent scheib killing off his own threads with these unreadable three-page mails
zewt: He's responding to feedback, same as Hixie does with his mega emails.
hixie responds concisely, he's responding with large paragraphs
i sure don't feel motivated to read all of that
seems like w3.org is back up, Hixie, please test
Where's the statement in HTML that all algorithms described are optimized for simplicity and clarity, not efficiency, so UAs may implement any algorithm that produces the same results?
shepazu: cool, thanks. i was actually pinging you to make sure everyone in boston was ok!
looks like the storm hasn't hit yet though
Hixie: ah, ok… actually, I'm in North Carolina, not Boston
aah
and the storm isn't due here until late tonight or tomorrow, then another several hours to Boston
thanks for asking though
NC has a lot of hurricanes, so I'm not that worried
